30647710.review: Utterly charming visual novel (not an adventure!) about bright young minds in turn-of-the-century Vienna. Each episode covers a different character, Ep. 1 a composer secretly in love with her mentor, Ep. 2 a portrait painter struggling to capture all facets of his subjects, Ep. 3 a mathematician who needs to disguise herself as a man to be taken seriously. Each character is shown to perceive a hidden reality, be it sounds, images or ideas where they draw their inspiration from. Along the way you encounter famous Viennese such as Sigmund Freud and Gustav Klimt. It's really beautiful, artistic, grown-up stuff - just be prepared that there is almost zero interactivity, only four or five different choices you can take per episode.

30070936.review:
Okay bear with me because I'm no good with words, especially with a game that leaves you absolutely speechless (in the good way).
This game is genuinely beautiful and well developed. The motifs and imagery in it are absolutely stunning, empowering to both the protagonist and players. Its story line is simple yet fluid, focused on a young and talented violinist named Wilma who aims for recognition and acceptance while struggling with her inner demons. The game expresses that it's okay to have your doubts and anxiety, in yourself, your situation, and in others, but that you should not let your fears take control you. With every note composed, Wilma finds the strength and courage to counter each uncertainty, and her final work is sure to leave a tear in your eye with its gorgeous tones and symbolism.
Many thanks to the team who developed such a beautiful game with a story we can relate to and the amazing cuts of music that sparked a variety of emotions. I highly recommend this game for anyone who'd want to enjoy an extraordinary yet simple piece of art. It's honestly worth every penny. I cannot express enough how amazing it is.

30009271.review:
以下内容仅针对第一章。
  你会花多少精力去玩一款免费游戏，一分钟？一小时？The Lion’s Song颠覆了我对免费游戏的传统印象。第一章的免费试玩让我深深爱上了这款像素风的文字游戏，也让我毫不犹豫地掏出钱包购买了季票，等待着更多故事的发生。
  为了吸引更多的玩家，很多叙事类游戏开始在剧情以外的其他元素上有所创新：比如Her Story，在游戏剧情并不那么出挑的情况下，通过关键词搜索将分裂的视频整理成符合逻辑顺序的剧情，这样的游戏体验倒是给人耳目一新的感觉。而由Mi'pu'mi Games带来The lion’ song亦是在游戏体验上花了很大的心思。当时无意间搜索到的免费游戏却出人意料地广受好评，它绝不是简单的点击游戏，也不是单纯的视觉小说游戏。虽然它表面上看起来平淡无奇，但音乐的配合与文字的律动，伴随着剧情的推进，使得这款并无任何人声的叙事游戏把故事说到了人的内心深处。
  整个游戏的故事背景设定在20世纪初的奥地利，讲述了四位不同行业者的心路历程。16年7月免费放出的第一章Silence，间接描述了才华横溢的小提琴演奏家Wilma，被只重名利的大叔级教授所玩弄。在编曲不顺利的情况下，教授将Wilma安排一个山间小屋以缓解压力，单纯的她在到达小屋后，却发现教授已经安排她一周后演奏新曲，原本想安心作曲的Wilma不得不一人只身山间，面对更大的压力，几度走向崩溃。在一通陌生电话的指引下，她经过多次心理挣扎，最终创作出了名为The lion’s song的小提琴曲，演出大获成功。
  游戏的最大特色在于，故事情节并不是依靠人声来传递，而是通过暗黄色的场景、背景音乐和文字的转变与结合，慢慢讲述着Wilma在来到小屋进行创作这整个过程的内心变化。一方面，游戏中的文字并非那么平淡地出现，而是会跟着场景的需要“律动”：Wilma在纠结挣扎之时，文字会跟着抖动；灵感到来之时，文字就跟着舞动起来，就像是一个个火柴人扭动着自己的身躯。文字所表达的情感就以这样动感的方式呈现给玩家，让玩家更直观地感受到Wilma的情绪变化。另一方面，若你能静下心来体会游戏，你会发现随着背景音乐的跌宕起伏，自己仿佛成为了Wilma，在遇到创作瓶颈时她的内心想法都会涌上自己的心头：傍徨、痛苦、无助，甚至是绝望，这种种表现不禁让人回想起自己遇到的诸多坎坷和遭遇。
  而最后Wilma所演奏的曲子，缜密的旋律中夹带着希望与压抑，仿佛在诉说着自己的创作人生，也许正是应了那句“只要跨过去，你的潜力就会无限”。

29988707.review:
One of the best representations of how Video Games as a media is a form of art, just like music or paintings.

The gameplay, while being simply point-and-click, conveys the story to the player through their own actions, such as [spoiler] choosing who to paint, how to paint, or using what as the inspirationfor your song [/spoiler]. 

The stories of the protagonists themselves are inspiring, with each of the short episodes having a great ebb and flow of story-telling, keeping the players intrigued and invested in theprotagonists, and thus, their stories.

All in all, a true piece of art capable of inspiring aspiring youngsters, worthy of many awards!

29826544.review:
[h1]경고: 이 평가는 주관적인 평가가 담겨 있습니다.[/h1]

사자의 노래 에피소드 1- 침묵은 슬럼프에 빠진 바이올리니스트 윌마에 관한 이야기입니다. 여러분은 윌마를 조종하면서 다양한 상황을 맞이하게 될 것이고 그에 따라 발생하는 선택지를 골라 이야기를 이어나가는 선택형 게임입니다. 저택이라는 한정적인 공간에서 게임을 진행하지만 전혀 지루하지 않을겁니다. 작곡을 하기 위해 영감이 잘 떠오르지 않는 윌마의 심리를 대사를 통해 직접적으로 느끼게 해주며 여기에 움직이는 도트 글자가 그 효과를 더욱 가중시킬뿐만아니라 악몽이라는 소재가 이를 더욱 가중십니다. 또 우연히 받은 전화를 통해 알게 된 남성 리오와 나누는 이야기 역시 게임을 더욱 흥미롭게 만듭니다. 마지막으로 이 게임을 하고 나면 창작이라는 것이 예술가에게는 얼마나 고된 일인지를 알 수 있는 게임입니다.

여담이지만 도트 그래픽을 너무 잘 활용한 게임입니다. 약간의 스포일러가 될 수도 있지만 두번째 악을 꿀 때, 조금씩 차오르는 물 도트에서 살짝 긴장했습니다. 마지막으로 스토리를 다 보고 나시면 개발자들이 게임 속에서 구현되어 차를 마시고 있습니다.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
장점
-저택이라는 좁은 배경임에도 불구하고 다양한 선택지라는 개념을 이용해 이야기를 이어나가는 재미
-휼륭한 도트그래픽
-잘 드러나는 심리

단점
-영어를 모른다면 플레이가 힘들다. (그래도 적어도 내용 이해는 가시겠죠?)
-사람 취향에 따라 지루할수도 있다. (필자는 재미있었습니다.)

29813032.review:
Pela minha paixão por jogos pixealizados, gostei muito dele. O jeito como descreve a música, e um pouquinho da história da moça foram coisas que me fizeram gostar demais desse jogo. Uma pena eu não conseguir continuar a jogar por ter que comprar os outros episódios e gostaria muito de poder terminar. Porém, recomendo de coração esse jogo <3 The Lion's Song foi uma surpresa agradável, se você acha que é mais um jogo com gráficos retro/pixelados está enganado(a)! A análise pode ser ligeiramente longa, mas pretendo que a mesma seja útil para aqueles que estão pensando em baixá-lo! Como ele é gratuito, não terá grandes perdas caso não goste, se isso for possível de acontecer. 

O jogo começa com uma jovem musicista chamada Wilma sofrendo para compor sua mais nova obra e pressionada por seu professor Arthur, o mesmo sugere que ela devesse ir para um lugar isolado para conseguir terminar de compor. A história começa a desenrolar a partir daí. 

A jogabilidade é bastante simples e intuitiva, as escolhas que você toma nos diálogos tem alguma influência, a mesma pode se tornar um pouco cansativa caso não goste muito de point-n-click. 

Quanto a atmosfera e a temática para aqueles que gostam de arte, principalmente música, irá adorar o que o jogo tem a oferecer, além de uma boa dose de perguntas para nós jogadores enquanto jogamos.  

After just 0.7 hours on this game, only doing episode 1, I love it. I'm thinking about buying the season pass, so I can play all the episodes, but if I don't, just telling you, playing through episode 1 is a interesting story, about the main character (of episode 1), Wilma on her journey to create a piece of music. She has to work over the problems that approach her, while making the music. That's a basic, lazy explanation of the game, the game go much deeper than that. If you'd like to know more about the game before downloading it (episode 1 is free, but the rest are like $3.00 0r something), just message me about the game... I loved this game, 10/10!

29618056.review:
En Autriche dans les années 1900, on suit dans ce premier épisode une talentueuse compositrice Wilma, qui se prépare pour son concert, le moment déterminant de sa carrière. 
Le talent de Wilma fut découvert par Arthur Caban, un riche professeur d'université, qui l'invita à Vienne. 
Arthur est profondément convaincu que Wilma va jouer un rôle majeur dans l'avenir de la musique moderne.
Il l'envoie dans son chalet alpin pour qu'elle récupére son inspiration et muse.
Seule dans ce chalet, sous la tempête battant son plein, Wilma fait soudainement une rencontre inattendue. 

Malgré un graphisme des plus simpliste, on se laisse emporter agréablement dans cette charmante petite histoire ou l'on découvre une jeune compositrice, cherchant l'inspiration pour terminer son chef-d'œuvre.
Le jeu attire les joueurs dans une histoire de lutte personnelle pour la créativité, l'inspiration ET l'IMPORTANCE des connexions humaines qui se créent et nous aide à réussir.

Très belle musique au violon qui transmet des émotions.

Visuel novel gratuite épisode 1 en français court 1h
20 succès pour l'épisode 1 (2 succès ou faut vraiment chercher)

29495807.review:
Da die erste Episode kostenlos spielbar ist, lohnt sich ein Blick auf dieses Point & Click Spiel im Retro-Look. 
Hauptfigur ist die junge Wiener Musikstudentin Wilma, die vor einer vielversprechenden Karriere als Komponistin steht und von ihrem Professor Arthur Caban unterstützt wird. Kurz vor einem wichtigen Auftritt kann sie ihre neueste Komposition jedoch nicht fertigstellen und zieht sich in Arthurs Ferienhaus in den Alpen zurück, um ihre Muse zu finden. 

Es handelt sich hierbei eher um einen Visual Novel als ein klassisches Point & Click Spiel. Entscheidungen, auch wenn sie am Ende der Episode aufgeschlüsselt werden, nehmen vermutlich keinen Einfluss auf die sehr lineare Spielhandlung. Obwohl Musik thematisiert wird, handelt es sich um ein eher ruhiges Spiel mit wenigen Handlungsmöglichkeiten oder -freiheiten. Die kleinen Rätsel sind schnell gelöst, stehen sie ja eigentlich nicht wirklich im Mittelpunkt, sondern eher das, was in Wilma vorgeht. Doch im Ausgleich zur starren Handlung liefern die Macher wunderbar authentische, liebenswerte Figuren, die einem in der sehr kurzen Spielzeit von ca. 30 - 40 Minuten doch schnell ans Herz wachsen.

Ob diese in den nächsten Episoden wieder auftauchen, bleibt abzuwarten. Der Schlussatz und die Vorschau auf die nächste Episode haben auf jeden Fall Appetit auf mehr gemacht. Fans von Visual Novels und Gelegenheitsspielern sei The Lion's Song auf jeden Fall empfohlen!

29452128.review: Pela minha paixão por jogos pixealizados, gostei muito dele. O jeito como descreve a música, e um pouquinho da história da moça foram coisas que me fizeram gostar demais desse jogo. Uma pena eu não conseguir continuar a jogar por ter que comprar os outros episódios e gostaria muito de poder terminar. Porém, recomendo de coração esse jogo <3

29438800.review:
옛날 옛적, 포인트 앤 클릭 형식의 어드벤쳐가 전성기를 구가하던 적이 있었다. '원숭이 섬의 비밀'을 필두로 한 루카스아츠의 어드벤쳐 부터, '킹스 퀘스트' 등 퀘스트 시리즈를 냈던 시에라 등등. 수많은 명작이 이 시기에 쏟아 졌었다.

스토리를 풀어나가는데 뛰어난 형식임에도 불구하고, 어느순간부터 발전이 정체되기 시작하더니 급기야는 주류의 저편으로 멀어져 갔다. 중간에 '롱기스트 저니'나 '사이베리아' 같은 역작이 나왔지만, 이미 FPS 등에서는 어드벤쳐를 뛰어넘는 연출과 스토리 전개를 보여주던 중이었기 때문에, 대세를 돌리기엔 역부족이었다.

그렇게 역사의 뒤안길로 사라지나 했던 포인트앤 클릭 어드벤쳐는 스팀의 등장과 인디 개발자의 노력으로 다시한번 전성기를 맞이하고 있다. 지금 스팀에 들어가보면, 고전 뿐만 아니라 수많은 포인트 앤 클릭 어드벤쳐를 만날 수 있다.

The Lion's Song 또한 그런 인디 포인트 앤 클릭 어드벤쳐 중 하나다.

4개의 에피소드로 구성되어 있으며, 현재 2개의 에피소드가 출시 되었다. 그 중, 첫번 째 에피소드인 Silence 편은 현재 무료로 즐길 수 있어서, 간만에 포인트 앤 클릭 스타일의 어드벤쳐를 즐겨보게 되었다.

게임의 테마가 상당히 독특하다. 예술가가 자신의 작품을 찾아가기 까지의 고뇌를 테마로 하고 있는데, 이런 테마는 비단 이 에피소드 뿐만 아니라 이 시리즈 전체의 테마가 될 것 같다.

에피소드 1의 주인공은 바이올린 연주가겸 작곡을 하는 아리따운 여성이다. 슬럼프인지 무대 울렁증인지 아무튼 복합적인 이유로 자신만의 곡을 쓰는데 두려움을 느끼고 있다. 어쨌든 1주일 안에 곡을 써야 하는 절박한 상황. 그런 슬럼프를 극복하기 위해, 알프스의 한 산장으로 들어가면서 본격적으로 이야기가 시작된다.

게임 플레이는 포인트 앤 클릭 형식으로 진행되며, 퍼즐이라 할만 한 요소가 거의 없어서 이리저리 클릭하다 보면 자연 스럽게 클리어 된다. 플레이 시간 또한 길지 않아서, 짬짬이 하다 보면 어느새 에피소드1의 엔딩을 보게 된다.

하지만, 어떤 대화를 선택하느냐에 따라 중간중간에 분기가 있기 때문에, 2회차를 즐길면 또 새로운 것을 발견할 수 있다.

플레이가 단조로운 만큼, 이 게임은 스토리를 즐기는 게임이다. 바이올린 음악가가 자신감을 찾아가는 잔잔한 분위기의 스토리가 이 게임의 장점이자 단점이다. 흔히 볼 수 없는 소재를 게임으로 푼 점은 장점이 될 수 있겠으나, 갈등과 긴장감을 주지 못하는 평이한 스토리 전개는, 게임을 금방 지루하게 한다.

매력적이고, 보호 본능을 일으키는 여 주인공이 어려움을 하나하나 극복할 때 마다, 아름다운 바이올린 선율이 흘러 나오는데 잔잔한 분위기와 겹쳐져서 은근히 힐링이 된다. 눈을 감고 들어보면, 효과가 배가 된다.

평이한 내용에 영어 또한 어렵지 않아서, 영어에 대해 어느정도의 지식만 있다면 내용을 이해하는대 문제가 없다.

개인적으로 게임에서 가장 흥미로왔던 것은 이색적인 유럽의 분위기 였다. 가끔 유럽 영화를 볼 때 느낄 수 있는 문화적 이질감을 이 게임에서도 그대로 느낄 수 있다. 그런데, 그게 게임에서 느껴지니 오히려 흥미롭고, 마치 내가 오스트레일리아에 놀러왔다거나 유럽의 예술인 코스프레를 하고 있는 듯한 느낌을 준다.

게임을 클리어하면 에피소드2에 대한 예고를 해준다. 에피소드2는 이미 출시되어 있기 때문에, 1에 흥미를 느낀 사람이라면 해볼 가치가 있다는 생각이 든다.

29283436.review:
The Lion's Song  foi uma surpresa agradável, se você acha que é mais um jogo com gráficos retro/pixelados está enganado(a)! A análise pode ser ligeiramente longa, mas pretendo que a mesma seja útil para aqueles que estão pensando em baixá-lo! Como o primeiro episódio é gratuito, não terá grandes perdas caso não goste, se isso for possível de acontecer. 

O jogo começa com uma jovem musicista chamada Wilma sofrendo para compor sua mais nova obra e pressionada por seu professor Arthur, o mesmo sugere que ela devesse ir para um lugar isolado para conseguir terminar de compor. A história começa a desenrolar a partir daí. 

A storyline do jogo é incrivelmente bem construída, todos os episódios possuem uma ligação entre si. O segundo, ainda no mundo das artes, você joga com um pintor Franz que também se encontra desafiado a inovar sempre como pintor em busca de sua identidade.

No terceiro capítulo, é sobre Emma, uma matemática muito bem humorada que luta contra o machismo para ter seu trabalho reconhecido. 

Já no Quarto, é onde todas as histórias se encontram de maneira incrível dando um fim (ou vários fins) ao jogo. 

A jogabilidade é bastante simples e intuitiva, as escolhas que você toma nos diálogos tem alguma influência, a mesma pode se tornar um pouco cansativa caso não goste muito de point-n-click. 

Quanto a atmosfera e a temática para aqueles que gostam de arte, principalmente música, irá adorar o que o jogo tem a oferecer, além de uma boa dose de perguntas para nós jogadores enquanto jogamos. 

Valeu a pena cada centavo gasto neste jogo, você o termina ansioso por um replay para desbloquear outras endings para as personagens.

Recomendo para aqueles que gostam de jogos com boa história e reflexões morais.

29271274.review:
Die erste Episode dauert, wie zu erwarten, nicht sehr lange. Nach 70 Minuten, mit einer kleinen Pause, war sie bereits beendet.
Stellenweise wird man als Zuschauer nicht ganz abgeholt und erkundet so die Spielemechanik auf eigene Faust, so weiß man auch nicht so recht ob jetzt ein anklicken irgendwelche Auswirkung hat.
Für eine Demo ist das Konzept gut umgesetzt, ob sich der Kauf weitere Episoden lohnt mag ich nicht beurteilen. 
Irritieren scheint mir die Verkaufspolitik zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt jedoch schon, so kostet der Season Pass 9,99€, Episode 3 bzw. Epesode 4 verlangen den gleichen Preis.

That being said, it's a decent game and unique in it's approach.  It's worth a play through since it's free.

29235999.review: As a musician and avid psychology researcher, I loved what I've seen of this game thusfar for a number of reasons. Aside from showing how the mind of a composer and performer operates, it reflects some of the modern difficulties of pursuing admiration and success, particularly to the point that you stop listening to your inner voice. It gives a great example of how failing to accept and confront the more difficult aspects of life can manifest into a bigger problem and the ways we may go into denial after refusing to acknowledge it.

29216756.review:
짧고 단순한 노벨게임
매 에피소드마다 다른 주인공의 이야기를 그리는 옴니버스 식이다.
에피소드 4는 아직 발매가 안돼었고 2017년중 발매예정이다.
현재 발매된 에피소드증 1은 어느 슬럼프에 빠진 바이올리니스트 여성이 신곡을 쓰는 일주일간을.
에피소드 2는 신인 삽화가가 자신을 마주하는 이야기를 그리고 있다.
두 이야기 모두 제법 심리학적인 관점에서 각 인물들의 내적 트라우마를 다루고 있고.
짧지만 이야기에 깊이가 있다. 
더해서 그 이야기를 독자에게 보여주는 연출이 무척이나 좋다.
에피 1과 2가 각각 별개의 스토리 이므로 궁금하면 무료인 에피소드 1을 해보자 
어떤 분위기인지 해보는게 가장 빠를 것.

+
에피소드 3이 발매가 되서 추가
에피소드 3의 경우 아직 학계에 여성이 진출하지 않은 시대를 배경으로 한다. 변화에 관한 수학 이론을 증명하려고 노력하는 아마추어 여성 수학자가 주인공이며 스토리텔러가 시대 설정상 여성 인권이 멸시받는 부분을 강하게 부각하려고 여기저기 노력을 많이 했지만 개인적으로 요즘 한국에서 종종 오용되는 구시대적 패미니즘 팔이에 질린 관계로 전 에피소드중에 가장 몰입도가 낮았다. 오히려 에피소드 1 2에서 나왔던 인물들이 스쳐 지나가는게 더 반가웠을 정도.

+
마지막 에피소드인 에피소드 4가 나와서 추가.
시리즈의 대미를 마무리짓는 화, 에피소드 1 2 3의 주변인물 셋 그리고 한명의 전직 기자출신 장교의 담화가 이 에피소드 4의 시작과 끝이다. 플레이어는 주변인물 셋과의 대화를 통해 그동안의 선택이 인물들에게 미친 영향, 후일담, 그리고 그들의 과거에 대한 비하인드 스토리를 볼 수 있다. 엔딩을 총괄하는 에피소드임과 동시에 이 에피소드 자체도 주변인물 셋과의 대화 후 셋의 향후에 영향을 준다. 모든 선택이 끝나고 나면 열차가 목적지에 도착하고 나레이션 형식으로 후일담을 깔끔하게 정리해준다. 

시리즈의 화룡점정을 찍는 완벽한 결말 방식이라고 생각한다. 

-총평-

시리즈 전체를 관통하는 BGM, 유려한 도트, 따뜻한 색감, 깔끔한 마무리 뭐 하나 거를 타선이 없다.
굳이 꼽자면 각 에피소드 스토리에 사람 취향마다 호불호가 갈릴수는 있다.
선택분기형 텍스트 게임을 좋아하는 사람이라면 해볼만 한 게임
소설 읽듯 진득하게 텍스트를 읽는 게임에 취향이 없으면 구매하지 말도록 하자.

에피소드 1화는 무료에 나머지 다 합친 시즌패스도 마넌돈이다. 겜도 좋은대 가격도 매우 혜자인것.
개인적으로는 스팀리뷰가 압도적으로 긍정적이 나올 수 밖에 없는 게임이라고 생각한다.

29151585.review:
Análisis de The Lion's Song: Episode 1 - Silence:

"Silence" Episode, más que un juego, una obra, gratis, al español y que te abrirá un mundo distinto, plagado de Arte, pequeñas desiciones que nos ponen en el puesto de la protagonista, una Compositora proveniente de Viena llamada Wilma que al verse en la situación de tener que llegar al éxito en su vida se ve en de busca inspiraciones, las cuales nosotros mismos tendremos que encontrar, sumergiendonos dentro de la obra y obligandonos casi, a seguir el juego en su todo.

Una obra que te enamora, que te cautiva, que te inspira, sin duda, una obra que HACÍA falta hoy en día, distinta y preciosa que a pesar de ser bastante corta, te deja muchísimo para ser un juego gratis, en tan poco tiempo te adentra completamente en la historia y en los personajes, dándote a desear saber cada vez más sobre ellos, acompañado de un estilo de sepia pixelado que enamora.

Una obra Mágnifica de total recomendación que se merece cada uno de sus premios.
9.5/10

Episodio 1:

Me salio publicidad en facebook de que estaba gratuito, entre y al ver las criticas decidi darle una oportunidad.

Es un juego extremadamente corto (40 minutos) aunque luego puedes rejugarlo para hacer todos los logros (yo pasé), es bastante contenplativo, pasan cosas y apenas puedes intervenir, no hay rompecabezas ni nada parecido, simplemente una historia que vas siguiendo.

28739031.review:
[h1]It's art[/h1]
I'm not just referring to the 4-bit desaturated backgrounds. I whole heartedly put the Lion's Song up there with games like Kentucky Route Zero and Dear Esther which push the artistic and intellectual boundaries in games.

Some will think I'm smoking an expensive vegan platter for thinking this game is amazing, but I have an appreciation for original, poetic writing which conveys complex emotion, experience and atmosphere in just a few words.

[h1]Casual adventure[/h1]
It's close to a visual novel. Single mouse button interface, no verbs, inventory management or direct character control. Linear. Only an occasional lightweight adventure game puzzle earns it that title.

[h1]Done right[/h1]
None of the cheap gimmicks of most casual adventures like repetitive puzzles or hidden object BS to pad out the game. It's completely focused on the atmosphere and characters.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
[list]
[*] Almost every line is poetic and charming.
[*] It uses minimalist techniques to great effect: emphasised words dance on the screen or the backdrop falls away to emphasise a whole conversation. Unexpected sound effects lurk in the silence.
[*] Pace. Unexpected events like flashbacks and surreal dream vignettes help keep your attention.
[/list]

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
[list]
[*] Episodes are very short (1 hour), and only 2 of 4 episodes are out (at time of writing), but they seem to be mostly separate stories with their own ending, so this isn't a big deal.
[*] The game may be too simplistic, unrelatable, dialogue heavy or uneventful for some. Personally I think good writing transforms these more into minimalist, empathetic, endearing and relaxing, respectfully, but you do have to be in the right mood.
[/list]

Overall, I highly recommend this game, especially if you enjoy relaxing games full of beautiful art and music.

28430194.review:
What is it like to be a gifted artist? The Lion's Song, a pretty nice looking episodic indie adventure title by Mi'pu'mi Games, aims to answer that question for you. So far, it's doing an excellent job! 

The Lion's Song is a story-driven game in which you follow your character through their creative process.
The story of the first episode is about a composer who is trying to write what is to be one of the most important pieces of her career.

The second revolves around a painter blessed with the gift to visually see the different aspects of people's personalities, but, to his frustration, not quite all of them.

The third, due in 2017, will be about a female mathematician who struggles to find her place in a men's world.
The fourth and final episode, also scheduled for 2017, will connect the previous three stories and reveal how your choices affected the final outcome.

Pros
+ Beautiful graphics
+ Great story
+ Very immersive
+ A lot of replayability because of choices

Cons
- A little short
- Not all episodes are out yet

Read the rest of my review here:
http://www.keengamer.com/article/15244_the-lions-song-review

28400126.review:
狮王之歌：第一章—寂静
你扮演的是富有天赋的小提琴家威尔玛女士，在一次沙龙上你的演出震撼了所有来宾，他们纷纷给你的老师亚瑟来信，赞美之词溢于言表。亚瑟先生于是让你写一首新的曲子，但你却陷入创作的瓶颈。这时亚瑟提议让你去他位于阿尔卑斯山的小木屋，那里没有干扰，可以让你集中精力创作。到达之后你发现包里有亚瑟先生给你的一封信，信里亚瑟告诉你他下周在维也纳安排了一场音乐会，邀请了许多重要来宾参加，你需要在那时创作出新的曲目并现场演奏，我们已经走了太远，没有退路了。你陷入深深的恐慌，1周，怎么可能！？人迹罕至的阿尔卑斯山脉、亚瑟先生以前住过的木屋、窗外嘶吼的暴风雨、打来电话的陌生男子里昂、从未间断的梦魇，这7天里的点点滴滴化作笔尖上跳动的音符，成为你创作的灵感，谱写出最动人心弦的——狮王之歌。
游戏方式很简单，就是与场景里的物品互动，与人物对话。第一章的流程比较短。游戏的开场是我们第二章的主人公弗朗兹登上前往维也纳的火车；另外如果你读桌上写给亚瑟先生的信件，里面有一封是赞赏威尔玛与她年龄不相符的演出技艺，让他想到他在维也纳见过的一名画肖像画的画家，并叫亚瑟一定要来看看他画的画。没错，就是我们第二章的主人公，具有异禀天赋的弗朗兹。
前三章看似毫无关系的3个人物，在最后一章他们的命运被交织在一起，你会发现你之前做出的选择将影响他们的结局。

Lion's Song Episode 1 tells the story of a young woman which studies composition and is pushed into composing a new piece within a week.
For this she finds herself in an isolated hut in the mountains, trying to find her muse.

Storytelling and characters are interesting and intuitive. 
Depending on the choices you make she composes different musical pieces.

The first episode lasts about 30 minutes and there isn't  much to it in terms of gameplay - don't expect an actual point and click adventure with riddles to solve or anything.
It's an interactive novel really, with no dubbing - only text - and a unique art style.

28288182.review:
Honestly I've never really felt the need to rate a game on steam before. Even though brief, this was one of the most captivating experiences I've had in a long time. It moved me in ways I forgot I could I be moved. I felt things I hadn't felt in years. The image of lightning trapped in a bottle, the image of a caged artist trying to break free; that's what this is really all about. And as such, I identify with her struggle, as I am also an artist caged within my own mind. An artist stuck in the darkest places imaginable. Creating, to survive. 

If you love incredibly well developed stories and just want to be taken away on the cadence of the wind for a while, I would recommend at least downloading the free Episode 1 to experience this artist's beautiful view point.

Thank you to the creator's of this game, you've helped me get another step further out of this dark cellar of depression that I live in.

Someday I may get my work published and return the favor for you.

A huge fan,

Rora

I have not been a struggling artist but I can still understand the pressure of being creative with a deadline. The first episode in The Lion's Song is about just that. You play as a promising violinist call Wilma who heads up to a cabin in the alps to finish a concert piece. The gameplay is mainly about choice and consequence like the later Telltale games and the choices are mostly about   

The episode lasts for an hour and only includes a couple of locations but really makes the most of them. The choice to only include a reddish color palette fits the mood perfectly, it feels more like a historical document. But what really stood out is the music and sound design, it's incredibly well done.

If a story centered on music, emotions and relationships in early 20th century Vienna sounds intriguing then you should absolutely play it. Highly recommended!

27670360.review:
Was für eine herrliche Komposition.
Die erste Episode von THE LION'S SONG ist nun für mich nach gut 40 Minuten vorbei und ich bin begeistert. Ich möchte über die Geschichte nicht viele Worte verlieren, es lohnt sich, sie selbst zu entdecken. Aus reiner Perspektive des Gameplays wird dies auch jeder mühelos schaffen, so ließe sich THE LION'S SONG als Visual Novel mit Point & Click Elementen beschreieben. Im Endeffekt folgt man dementsprechend Dialogen, trifft Entscheidungen, klickt sich durch den Bildschirm und löst hie und da ein kleines Rätsel - auch wenn dieser Titel schon fast zu viel des Guten ist, sind diese wirklich auf einem seichten Level angesiedelt.
Für ein raffiniertes Gameplay kann man THE LION'S SONG entsprechend nicht auszeichnen aber das möchte das Spiel auch gar nicht. Es möchte mit einem liebevollen Pixelart-Look eine Geschichte erzählen und den Spieler mit einer tollen Soundkulisse in seinen Bann ziehen. Wer nun auf eine Geschichte hofft voller Wenungen, "WTF"-Momenten und Szenen in denen die Tränendrüse bis auf den letzten Tropfen ausgequetscht wird - der wird enttäuscht werden. THE LION'S SONG erzählt ruhig, subtil und nah an der Realität.
Nicht jedem wird dies gefallen aber wer Pixelart schätzt, sich auf eine Geschichte einlassen kann, die ist wie eben beschrieben und gefallen findet an einer schönen Soundkulisse, der wird sich mit THE LION'S SONG einen gefallen tun und mal ehrlich - für Lau, macht man eh recht wenig falsch. 
Ich freue mich derweil auf meinen zweiten Durchlauf, um auch noch die alternativen Wege erlebt zu haben und auch auf die kommenden Episoden. Das Spiel, so meine ich, ist sein Geld wert.

26738775.review:
Episode I - Silence:
Assuming the role of young Austrian composer Wilma, it is on the player to find inspiration within and around a lonely mountain lodge. The composition that they will (or won't?) come up with is crucial for Wilma's career and her own self-worth.

I already liked the first free episode for grappling with subjects that games seldomly touch on. It is a non-violent mature experience that won't rob you of your time and that can be experienced in a couple of different ways. I felt that there was a brooding atmosphere emanating from the game that made feel with the main character. It was a bit on the short side, but then again I suppose it was rather meant as a quick appetizer to pique one's interest in the upcoming episodes and characters.

Episode II - Anthology:
You are Franz Markert, an aspiring painter with the unique ability to uncover and visualize various layers of personality born by your models. Introduced to the Viennese high-society by your grandfather, you find yourself struggling with unexplained black-outs that leave you exhausted for days and your young career at risk of being nibbed in the bud.

Where to me the first episode felt like a short story a gloomy teenager might write, "Anthology" shone with fuller, more realized thoughts. Not only was there significantly more content - it also felt like the writing had finally found a confident tone, ready to touch on topics such a pride, old age, concern for others and finally understanding of the self.

Episode III - Derivation:
Assume the role of Emma, librarian by day, obsessed with the mathematics of change by night. Finding herself stuck in her studies, she turns to the sharp minds of "The Radius" - An exclusive club of mathematicians that, as she has to find out, is sorely lacking the Viennese Hospitality. Her attempt to make her voice heard not only underscores another stark dichotomy, it also makes herself the subject of change.

The longest and most ambitious episode yet, Derivation not only poses questions of identity and compassion, but does so by spinning analogies of mathematics philosophy around it.
While the maths may not always compell the most inquisitive minds, the game should be applauded for the unusual attempt at the very least!
Where it shines in my opinion, is the way in which it re-invents the visuals of the series with interactive diagrams and more daring perspective.
Another worthy entry to the series and perhaps most interactive yet!

I cannot recommend this little game enough and I also cannot wait for the story to continue with the next installment!

26715728.review:
I love episodic and decision-based games, but I was hesitant to play this due to its pixel graphics; graphics being a big part of gameplay for me.
However, I was not disappointed at all, and soon adjusted to the graphics, even finding them to be unique and well put together, making this game even more memorable for me.
The characters are all complete individuals and are relatable in their own ways; the dialogue is short and quick-witted, which is great because I have a short attention span.
The story also isn't something that I'd usually be interested in, but somehow Mi'pu'mi have made it work, and created an interesting and enjoyable storyline with frequent options that evoke different reactions from the characters involved, and I'm looking forward to the rest of the episodes coming out.

Primer capítulo y demo de esta pequeño pero íntimo juego disfrazado de aventura gráfica. 26136798.review:
One chapter down...

This is an exploration of creativity and the very human desires to create, be alone, and be together - all at once. It deals with what you might call "wrong longing" - the desire for things that aren't right for you. It deals with composition and inspiration, and with both the ideas of lonely friendship and the muse.

It's a strange experience, to be honest. Nothing happens, and yet everything significant still manages to transpire. It's a game that could only happen in this modern age of games-as-literature, but would not be out of place during the age of King's Quest. It's... a great experience.

26010960.review:
The Lion's Song - บทเพลงจากใจ
(หมายเหตุ:ผู้รีวิวได้เล่นไปแค่Chapterแรกเท่านั้น)

เนื้อเรื่องย่อ
"วิลม่า"นักดนตรีหญิงผู้มีพรสวรรค์ ได้ถูกเชิญชวนมาที่เวียนนาโดย"อาร์เธอร์ คาบาน" อาจารย์มหาวิทยาลัยผู้โด่งดัง
อาร์เธอร์นั้นขอร้องให้วิลม่ามาเป็นส่วนสำคัญของดนตรีในอนาคต
แต่เพราะวิลม่านั้นต่อสู้กับความ"หมดไอเดีย" พยายามแต่งเพลงให้ได้
อาร์เธอร์จึงแนะนำให้เธอไปพักอยู่ในกระท่อมเล็กๆในป่าเขา เพื่อให้เธอหาแรงบรรดาลใจ

เกมเพลย์
เกมนี้นั้นเป็นเหมือนนิยายภาพ
ทุกๆบทสนทนา ทุกๆเสียงและภาพ นั้นเหมือนสิ่งที่เราจินตนาการณ์จากหนังสือนิยาย
เกมนี้ใช้ภาษาอังกฤษล้วนๆ ซึ่งบางคำบางคนอาจจะไม่คุ้นมากนัก(เนื่องจากเป็นคำกลอน) จึงแนะนำให้มีดิกชันแนรีย์ติดไว้
ทางเลือกที่เกมมาให้เราเลือกนั้น ไม่ได้ส่งผลกับเนื้อเรื่องมากนัก แต่เหมือนกับ"ถ้าเราอยู่ในที่แบบนั้น เราคงทำแบบนี้"เสียมากกว่า
ภาพทั้งหมดในเกมนี้ใช้แค่3สีเท่านั้น แต่มันส่งความรู้สึกให้เราครบทุกรส ทั้งความตึงเครียด ความอบอุ่น ความเศร้า ฯลฯ
เสียงซาวน์ในเกมนี้ทำได้ดีมาก มันเสริมบรรยากาศได้ดี ทำให้เราเข้าถึงความรู้สึกตัวละครได้ชัดเจน
เมื่อเล่นจบแล้วจะมีให้เราดูว่ามีคนเลือกในสิ่งที่เราเลือกกี่เปอร์เซ็น ทำให้เราไม่รู้สึกผิดมากนัก เวลาเลือกอะไรไม่ถูกใจ5555

สรุป
ถึงแม้ว่าจะได้เล่นไปแค่Chapterเดียว แต่มันทำให้ผู้เล่นได้เรียนรู้อะไรหลายๆอย่าง
ทั้งแรงบรรดาลใจ คนที่สำคัญกับเรา คนที่เราสำคัญกับเขา และตัวเราเอง
ตัวละครที่เราเล่นนั้นอยู่ในจุดที่เราเชื่อว่าทุกๆคนเคยเป็นมาก่อน หรือถ้าไม่เคย เกมก็อธิบายให้เราเข้าใจได้ง่ายพอ ให้เราอินไปกับตัวละคร
1Chapterใช้เวลา1ชั่วโมง เป็นเกมสั้นๆ ที่เล่นแล้วเหมือนเรียนรู้อะไรที่เราไม่ได้ถามตัวเองบ่อยๆ

26007347.review:
Le premier épisode est gratuit, je me suis laissée tenter, pour le thème (en tant que musicienne et musicophile), le style narratif, et une nostalgie du style pixel. J

'ai toujours été fascinée en étant plus jeune des jeux anciens qui fonctionnaient sur une charte de couleur très limitée, et j'ai retrouvé cet aspect graphique dans Lion's Song. Ca m'a plu, je trouve ça réussi, harmonieux, pittoresque. 

Côté narratif, les dialogues sont malheureusement très simplistes... de même que les quelques idées sur la composition musicale. Malgré tout, le thème est classique : le blocage créateur de l'artiste. J'ai trouvé cette petite fable charmante, pour passer un petit moment tranquille, un peu poétique. La musique est très belle d'ailleurs. J'ai apprécié d'écouter "notre" composition à la fin. (est-ce que sa tonalité ne change pas d'ailleurs selon les choix fait en jeu?)

Le "gameplay" est ultra simple évidemment, vide diront certains, c'est du narratif. Il reste quand même plusieurs pistes différentes à explorer dans les choix multiples  pour faire sortir de nouvelles possibiltés de dialogues ou d'actions. C'est restreint, mais j'ai apprécié de chercher les différences malgré tout. 

Les références à la Vienne historique du début XXe et l'émergence de la nouvelle musique m'ont surprise aussi, ça pose un cadre réaliste qui ancre tout de suite l'histoire. Venant d'un jeu qui avait l'air tout à fait superficiel, j'ai été étonnée. (Ca parle à la musicophile en moi). Une ambiance en fait, en couleur, musique, et cadre.

En bref, ça ne paye pas de mine, mais c'est gratuit. Temps de jeu très court, très léger à installer évidemment. 

Note: le teaser sur l'épisode prochain. Une possiblité que les différents volets soient liés entre eux.

/////// SPOILER ////////

Une lettre contenue dans l'épisode parle d'un peintre célèbre à Vienne à la même époque, qui renouvelle l'histoire de la peinture (parallèlement à l'histoire de la musique). Le teaser présente un artiste en difficultés de création, serait-il possible que cela soit celui mentionné dans la lettre ? Fort probable à mon avis. J'adorerai l'idée que chaque pièce soit une "fable" sur un artiste différent de ce milieu historique. Ca donnerait une belle cohérence, et produirait différentes facettes sur l'acte de création.

What a wonderful, little game. Pretty short, but it is unique and beautiful in its simplicity. The art, the setting and scale, everything. 

You play Wilma, a young composer and musical prodigy, almost pressured into writing her grand piece of music by her professor.  To achieve that he offers her to spend time alone in his mountain hut. It was a pleasure to discover where Wilma draws her inspiration from, to hear the little bits of music slowly forming a melody more and more as she writes it down. Through that, you get to know her, what motivates her and her fears. It is a small, intimate story in its scale, one of finding yourself in finding inspiration, and the struggle of it all.  

Oh, and the music in the end as she performs her finished piece for the audience is simply gorgeous and moving. I enjoyed it very much.

Rewarding, intimate, beautiful; 'The Lion's Song' is a wonderfully nuanced story within a pleasant point-and-click-adventure format. Just as every backdrop is picturesque with detail, there are almost no prompts nor elements that do not reveal more about the setting or episode 1's titular heroine, 'Wilma', and every decision is backed by the game's beautiful score, breathing life into every scene and story beat, lending itself to replay-ability, if only to experience anything that might have been missed the first time.

To say any more would be to spoil what I hope you will play for yourself, 'The Lion's Story' episode 1 is a brave and quiet triumph of a game that neither overstays it's welcome nor feels to be over too soon, but instead lingers on in the mind (or, at least, my own) of the player like a familiar theme. 25716847.review:
The Lion's Song is a wonderful adventure game, that managed to captivate me in a matter of seconds. In the game's first episode, you are playing as Wilma, a musical student who has trouble with writing her latest composition. To try to solve that problem of hers, her teacher sends her to a lonely cabin in the Alps, where she's supposed to gain inspiration to finish her piece.
While being a little short with about 30 minutes of game time, this first episode already portrays what kind of game The Lion's Song aspires to be. It is a glimpse into human emotions and thoughts, a portrait of life in all its facets. We accompany Wilma on a rollercoaster of emotion, ranging from happy to sad, from tense to relaxed. Although the artstyle is rather simple, it still conveys all of these emotions so accurately, that you cannot help but feel with the characters. The animations are lovely and very well made. As music is a central element of this chapter, the soundtrack and effects are extremly fitting and underline the plot perfectly. The game feels like a musical piece itself at certain points.
This first Episode is well worth your time, and since it's free, you should definetely make this experience.

25460526.review:
So when I was searching for a decent looking free-to-play game I came along "The Lion's Song". It looked quite good and had an overwhelming amount of positive reviews so I thought "Hey! Why not?" Let me just say, this game deserves all the praise it gets. It is quite amazing.

Ok so I played Episode 1 which is currently the only episode released and it is also the only free one. You play the role of a musician that is composing a new piece of music that has to go above and beyond all of your previous pieces. It starts off with you being sent to a remote cabin in the mountains so that you can get inspiration for your piece. When she arrives she opens up a letter from her teacher in which he tells her that the piece she is composing is going to be played at a very big concert and that she will need to impress some very important people. I won't talk much about the story from then on as the story isn't too long (about 40-60 minutes) however I will say that the game delves into some quite personal issues.

One of the reasons that I loved this game is because on the surface it seems like nothing special however between the relationships that you make and the issues that you 'face' in the game, it ends up being an impactful game. Choice also plays a role in the story and usually changes the final piece that you compose. Between the characters, issues and choices, the story feels quite strong and well-developed. One of my favourite bits were probably the dream sequences especially the one in the well. There is such a deep meaning to that scene and that is sort of what she realises towards the end of the episode. Overall, there has been a lot of though put into this game and I love it. You can tell that this game is something special and by the end of episode one, I'm sure that you'll be waiting for the other episodes just like I am.

So finally, I'm not sure whether you would call this a Point and Click game or Visual Novel but I'm going to call it a hybrid between the two genres. The reason for this is because there is a lot of text and reading but there are also sections where you have to look at your surroundings and click on different objects to solve something. This style of gameplay is quite fun and for me, never got boring at all. The art of this game is also really nice as it mainly sticks to a certain colour (color for americans) palette for each scene. This with the different characters and landscapes just feel right for the story and is satisfying.

Overall [b] 8.5/10 [/b] Waiting for the new episodes!!!

Pros:
-Great story
-Many different choices
-Choices impact final piece
-Story covers issues that any may experience during their lifetime
-Nice art
-Nice gameplay
-Great music
-Easy 100% Achievements
-Free!!

Neutral:
-Length (Short but kinda fits for the game)

Cons:
-Waiting time for future episodes!!

This is a story driven game. There are no puzzles for one small item hunting event, and I am sure the developer designed it that way for us to enjoy the story. The game has pixelated graphics and monotone colors. However, that is not to say that is boring or has bad graphics, and instead adds to the game's story. This brings me to the strength of this game. The story is told through the perspective of Wilma, a musician under pressure to write a composition. We join Wilma and witness her struggles as she attempts to focus. It is an emotional story of Wilma finding herself and identifying what she truly desire in life. The gameplay is typical of point and click game, and does not offer anything extraordinary. I highly recommend this game who those who are interested in a story rich game. I look forward to the release of all the episodes.

El juego es, sencillamente, precioso. No puedo negar que la estética y el hecho de que sea gratuito hicieron que me decidiese a fijarme en él y descargarlo. Jugarlo ha sido una experiencia hermosa. 

Los gráficos están tremendame cuidados, con un pixel art que merecería la pena incluso fuera de un videojuego. La música, por su parte, está trabajada y genera un ambiente casi melancólico, muy acorde a la paleta de colores de la imagen. 

En esta primera parte nos ponemos en la piel de Wilma, una joven compositora que, tras un éxito arrollador, se encuentra en un mal momento a nivel creativo, incapaz de crear una nueva obra a la altura de la fama que ahora la precede. Arthur, director del instituto donde se encuentra Wilma al comienzo de la historia, no hace más que presionarla, pero le ofrece un refugio en una caballa que tiene en los Alpes. Lo que sucede a partir de entonces no es algo que deba revelarse, el juego lo hará por sí mismo. 

Lo recomiendo absoluta y encarecidamente. Es gratuíto y la única "pérdida" que podemos sufrir es de tiempo. Y ese tiempo, puedo asegurarlo, no se habrá perdido en absoluto. He de añadir, además, que este primer capítulo es corto, de apenas una hora, al menos en un primer recorrido sin completar todos los logros. Quizá ese es el único punto débil de este primer capítulo: su corta duración. Pero, dado que es gratuíto, es de esperar que su función sea la de enganchar al jugador para que se haga con la Season Pass o, paulatinamente, con el resto de capítulos. 

Yo, personalmente, ya estoy esperando por más. Y he de añadir que compartir este juego con otras personas enriquece la experiencia. Así la espera se hará más amena. 

P.D.: está completamente traducido a castellano y la traducción es considerablemente buena. Eso siempre es un punto a favor.

Petite review à chaud. Je viens juste de faire l'épisode 2, je l'ai A-DO-RE. Il est très intéressant. Je ne veux pas spoiler mais j'adore la personnalité du peintre. On retrouve certains liens avec le premier épisode que j'aime beaucoup. Il est bien plus abouti, plus long, on se balade dans plus d'un seul décor cette fois. En un jet j'ai fait 7 succès sur 21. J'ai encore beaucoup de choses à découvrir. Si vous avez aimé le premier je vous le conseille.

Seul petit regret, la musique est la même que celle de l'épisode 1, j'ai beau l'aimer j'aurais bien voulu un truc un peu différent.

Episode 01

J'ai découvert ce jeu au hasard. Déjà je félicite le fait que le premier épisode soit gratuit, ça permet de pouvoir découvrir un jeu et d'avoir, ou pas, envie de voir plus loin. Personnellement je prendrais le season pass quand l'épisode 2 sortira.

J'ai vraiment aimé cet épisode. L'atmosphère, la direction artistique, la musique. Un gameplay très simple, une histoire entrainante. Pas mal de choix à faire, guidés par les différents succès. Sur les 19 (si on ne compte pas le 20e qui est d'avoir tous les succès de l'épisode 1) j'ai réussi à en faire 17 sans guide, les deux derniers je pense que c'est un coup de chance de le faire sans aide. J'ai aimé recommencer plusieurs fois l'épisode pour tout débloquer parce que comme c'est assez rapide je n'ai pas trouvé ça ennuyant. J'ai mis un peu plus de deux heures à faire l'épisode à 100% en 4 essais. C'est assez court mais je trouve le prix du season pass raisonnable. 

Bref, allez-y les yeux fermés, c'est gratuit, au pire vous pourrez juste arrêter sans soucis et au mieux vous passerez un bon moment.

24951841.review:
Normalerweise gebe ich nix auf Kaufvorschläge welche mir die Steam-Shopseite hin und wieder vor die Nase drückt, da sich die meisten der gut gemeinten Vorschläge für meine Person als unbrauchbar erweisen. Doch letztens, am 6. August, traf  Steam mit dem unscheinbaren Indie-Kleinod „The Lion’s Song“ (=TLS) voll ins Schwarze. Sein herrlich altmodischer Look, das deutschsprachig-historische Setting, die Handlung an sich – eine Grafik-Novelle die wie für mich gemacht schien. :-)
Oookaaay, vielleicht war der Kostenpunkt mit 0,00€ für die erste der geplanten 4 Episoden auch ein wenig mitentscheidend, will ich gar nicht leugnen… ^^ … Aber die Neugier war nun da, also hab ich noch am selben Tag die wenigen Hundert MBs draufgeschaufelt, Episode 1 („The Silence“) angeschmissen und mich für eine knappe Stunde im alten Österreich Anno 1900 verloren. Wow! Wer hätte gedacht dass sich so viel Story und Liebe in so kurzer Spielzeit verstecken.

Wir erleben die Geschichte der jungen Musik-Studentin Wilma die sich an der Wiener Kunstakademie zu eine Art „Wunderkind“ entwickelt. Ihre letzten Arbeiten haben ein begeistertes Echo unter Musikkennern erhalten, und ihr vom Eifer angesteckter Uni-Professor Arthur erwartet von ihr eine neue Komposition die ihr, der Uni und natürlich auch ihm (als ihr Förderer) großen Ruhm innerhalb der Kunstszene bringen soll. Und das binnen weniger Tage. Dummerweise kommt sie mit ihrem zwischenzeitlich angefangenen Neu-Werk nicht weiter. Akuter Verdacht von Schreibblockade. Aber davon lässt sich Arthur nicht beirren und schickt Wilma mit Sack, Pack und Geige in eine einsame Hütte mitten in den Alpen, wo sie Ruhe und Inspiration für das erhoffte Meisterstück finden soll.
Dort angekommen bemüht sie sich ihre als „Lied des Löwen“ getaufte Komposition zu vollenden, droht jedoch trotz ihres Talents unter dem Leistungsdruck, der Einsamkeit und der Angst vorm Scheitern zu zerbrechen…

Die erste Episode von TLS fällt angesichts seiner Kürze überraschend textlastig aus und ist trotz vorhandener, jedoch spärlicher Interaktionsmöglichkeiten ein spannender Spiel-Roman der mehr auf leserlicher denn auf spielerischer Art fesselt. Bei genauer Betrachtung lässt sich eine gewisse Verwandtschaft mit Spielen wie beispielweise „The Walking Dead“ von Telltale Games erkennen, denn auch hier spielen klassische Rätsel eine eher untergeordnete Rolle, der Schwerpunkt liegt hier mehr auf Story, Charakteren und Multiple-Choice-Dialogen. Gerade durch letztere können Veränderungen im Handlungsverlauf dieser Episode herbeigeführt werden die sich nach abgeschlossener Spielsession erst bei einem Neustart richtig zu erkennen geben, und wie man es auch von Telltale längst kennt wertet dieses Spiel ebenfalls anhand einer Endstatistik die eigenen Entscheidungen im Vergleich mit denen aller anderen TLS-Spieler aus. Ein Adventure der alten Schule ist TLS also nicht, eher würde ich es als „in Pixel-Optik gehaltener, interaktiver Film“ beschreiben.
Für Retro-Look-Anhänger und Spieler mit starker Story-Affinität eignet sich TLS daher besonders, doch auch andere Spieler mit ganz anderen Vorlieben sollten dieser kleinen Spieleperle zumindest eine Chance geben. Ein Blick in diese anrührend geschriebene Geschichte lohnt sich absolut; es würde mich gar stark wundern wenn man sich dem Schicksal der Protagonistin tatsächlich so einfach entziehen könnte wenn man bereits mitten drin steckt – und außerdem kostet es ja nix. Ich habe TLS von der ersten bis zur letzten Spielminute genossen – und gleich noch zwei weitere Neustarts hinten drangehängt. Wilma war mir vom ersten Moment an ultra-sympathisch, ihr emotional aufgewühltes Wesen unglaublich greifbar, und ihre Sorgen, unerwiderten Sehnsüchte (betreffend Arthur) und das Gefühl der totalen Isolation – abgesehen von der Neuerfindung des Telefons als einzigen Draht zur Welt - konnte ich voll und ganz nachempfinden. Kompliment an die Autoren hinter dieser feinen Geschichte.

Das Hauptmenü von TLS gibt nur die Namen der folgenden Episoden preis, die jeweiligen Personen-Umrisse lassen allerdings vermuten dass jede dieser Episoden eine gänzlich neue Hauptfigur mit eigener Kunstbegabung bereithält. Inwieweit diese Neuzugänge mit Wilma in Zusammenhang stehen, ob Wilma überhaupt nochmal zurückkehren wird und wer der ungenannte junge Mann im Zug ganz zu Beginn von „The Silence“ ist, all das bleibt bis zum Erscheinen der Fortsetzungs-Episoden vorerst im Unklaren. Man darf gespannt bleiben.

Auch auf die Gefahr hin dass ich vor lauter Schwärmerei zur Übertreibung neige komme ich nicht umhin zu betonen wie schön TLS auf seine ganz eigene Art aussieht. Die auf eine stark reduzierte Farbpalette gebaute Pixelpracht erweckt den nostalgischen Charme alter Grafik-Adventures der späten 1980er-/frühen 1990er-Jahre, kommt mit einfach gehaltenen Animationen aus und sorgt in klassischer Zusammenarbeit mit gut geschrieben Texten für eine angenehm-altmodische Atmosphäre, weil ganz ohne Sprachausgabe. Die bewusste Beschränkung auf vorwiegend Schwarz-, Grau- und Rot-Braun-Töne mag anfangs gewöhnungsbedürftig sein, diese Stilentscheidung vermittelt so aber auch gekonnt das Gefühl in eine alt-österreichisch-deutsche Zeit versetzt zu werden. Natürliche Soundeffekte kommen sparsam aber passend zum Einsatz, Musik widerum hat hier angesichts der Story-Thematik selbstverständlich eine weitaus größere Bedeutung und ertönt korrekterweise mittels klassischer Instrumente. Sehr hörenswert.

Fazit:
Unverhofft entdeckt, ohne größere Erwartungen gestartet und binnen weniger Minuten begeistert. Mit seinem unverbrauchten Szenario, seiner technisch so simplen Umsetzung und seiner emotional sehr dichten Erzählung hat es TLS geschafft mich sofort gefangen zu halten. Der Fortsetzung in Form weiterer Episoden entgegne ich mit ehrlicher Vorfreude, auch wenn mir 10 Euro für den Season-Pass mit voraussichtlich nur knapp 3 weiteren Stunden Spielzeit etwas teuer scheinen. Aber vielleicht macht mir Steam ja demnächst ein Angebot dass ich nicht ablehnen kann... :D

24934702.review:
The Lion’s Song est une aventure narrative que nous devons au studio autrichien Mi’pu’mi. Il nous plonge au début du 20ème siècle et raconte l’histoire de plusieurs artistes/scientifiques sous un format épisodique. Le premier épisode est totalement gratuit et vous le trouverez sur Steam (bientôt sur iOS et android).
Ce premier épisode introduit la jeune musicienne Wilma qui peine à trouver l’inspiration et qui sous l’impulsion de son professeur (qui est aussi son amant) va profiter du calme dans une cabane perdue au fin fond des Alpes.
L’aventure prend la forme d’un point’n’click plutôt accessible et assez intuitif. L’interface est minimaliste et on interagira avec le décors pour avancer dans le titre. Il y a aussi des dialogues et cela semble avoir une importance puisqu’ils nous permettront de prendre des décisions qui devraient avoir une influence dans les prochains épisodes comme le fait Telltale. L’ambiance mélangeant pixel-art, bruitages et mélodies correspondent totalement à la narration. Ce qui rend l’aventure encore plus prenante alors qu’elle est plutôt courte, comptez 40 minutes pour terminer cet épisode. Je pourrais pester contre sa durée. Cependant, cet épisode est réussi et gonfler sa durée de vie juste pour le fun aurait appauvri la qualité du titre, il faut parfois prendre les choses telles qu’elles sont et ne pas attendre du titre qu’il soit comme on l’aurait voulu.
Mi’pu’mi a prévue quatre épisodes pour lesquels il faudra s’acquitter du saison-pass pour 9,99€ et si la suite est de la qualité du premier épisode, vous pouvez y aller en fermant les yeux. Pour le moment, seule le premier épisode est gratuit et je vous conseille de l’essayer, c’est tout de même une expérience qui ne conviendra pas à tout le monde, cependant, la diversité ne peut pas vous faire de mal.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-BHMi026MBs

Mes impressions complêtes sur [url=grettogeek.com]GrettoGeek.com[/url]

24845556.review:
[b]Este análisis se centra en The Lion’s Song: Episode 1 – Silence que es la primera parte de cuatro cuales restantes partes aun no han sido publicadas. Todo o detallado a continuación es solamente sobre el primer episodio.[/b]


“Silence” es completamente gratis y está traducido a nuestro idioma. Los otros tres se pueden comprar en un “Season Pass” que vale 9,99€ Un precio muy bueno para la calidad que tiene.

La primera parte de The Lion’s Song nos pone en la piel de Wilma, una estudiante de conservatorio que se retira a una cabaña en los Alpes para desconectar del mundo y buscar la inspiración. Una historia algo usada pero que toma un carácter personal y intimo gracias a la cantidad de detalles que nos cuentan de su protagonista.

La mezcla sutil que hay entre sus escenarios, animaciones detalladas y la música hacen destacar un cariño especial en todas las escenas. Se le coge cariño a la protagonista rápidamente y empatizas con su obra de una forma directa.
No es un juego desafiante ni difícil. La cantidad de opciones a elegir en pantalla hacen que avances casi de manera automática. Si quieres sacar todos los logros es otra historia, deberás hacer algunas cosas concretas y no otras pero nuestro primer juego será fluido y llegaremos al final en aproximadamente una hora. Te deja con muchas ganas de más. Estoy deseando que salgan los siguientes episodios.

En general no le encuentro ningún fallo al juego. Quizás que tiene algún error gramatical pequeño o alguna frase no me ha encajado del todo, pero tal vez es impresión mía.

La duración del título es aproximadamente de 3 horas si queremos sacar el 100% de logros. Si tenemos en cuenta eso podemos deducir que el total del juego rondara las 10-15 horas. Lo sabremos en el futuro (El cual espero que llegue pronto)



[b]Puntos positivos:[/b]
-	El primer episodio es gratis y esta 100% en español.
-	La calidad de los escenarios y animaciones de personajes. Con esa paleta de colores y esa atención al detalle.
-	Una historia personal que se disfruta.
-	Un apartado musical impresionante. Los efectos sonoros y la banda que acompaña durante el juego es de aúpa.


[b]Puntos negativos:[/b]
-	El primer episodio es corto. Una hora en total para los usuarios a los cuales no les interesen los logros. Queda ver cuánto duran los siguientes episodios.


[b]Resumen:[/b]
The Lion’s Song: Episode 1 – Silence es la perfecta introducción para un videojuego de su estilo. Te deja suficiente para probar, para engancharte. Te demuestra la calidad de lo que vendrá después y el cuidado que le han puesto. Un juego que recomiendo probar a todos los amantes de las aventuras graficas y de la música.

24729349.review:
La verdad es que en un principio lo descargué porque era gratuito y bueno, pensé que para echar el rato no estaría mal, pero finalmente he de decir que fue más que en un entretenimiento de si acaso una hora. 

A nivel estético, el juego me encanta. Soy un apasionado de la gráfica pixel retro, por lo que en ese sentido la experiencia me ha sido muy grata. No hay nada que decir con respecto a las mecánicas porque son las sencillas y clásicas que han tenido siempre las aventuras gráficas, lo cual no es ni bueno ni malo, pues al fin y al cabo el juego te da las herramientas que necesitas de la forma más cómoda e intuitiva posible. 

No obstante, todo lo anterior no es lo más relevante de este videojuego, lo ciertamente importante es el guión. El juego nos mete en la piel de una artista que es presionada por su amor platónico para componer una pieza que será tocada por ella misma en un concierto en el que acompañarán otros grandes artístas sinfónicos de la época. Esta artista se retirará a una pequeña cabaña en las montañas con el objetivo de encontrar la inspiración que necesita, ¡y aquí encontramos la clave del juego! Encontrar la inspiración. A lo largo del juego iremos viendo la forma en la que nuestra protagonista aprovecha todo lo que encuentra en su entorno para convertirlo en música: el sonido de la lluvia, un párrafo de un texto filosófico, un poema, una llamada telefónica e incluso una vieja carta. En sí, el juego es un claro ejemplo de la ídea básica de creación: el artista toma del mundo exterior aquellos elementos que expresan de la mejor forma posible aquello que alberga en su mundo interior.  En mi opinión, eso es lo mejor de la obra. 

En cuanto a lo demás, me gustaría investigar algo más sobre las decisiones que se pueden tomar en el juego sobre las aspiraciones de la protagonista, pues según tengo entendido, el resultado final varías de cómo afrontamos las variantes que se nos presentan. 

En conclusión, un buen juego con una idea brillante en el interior y de una estética interesante. Espero ansioso otros capítulos que sin duda compraré.

Meeeeeeh. Definitely worth a look, and I loved the ending, but I can only recommend it since it's free.
The 'searching for inspiration' bits were kind of meandering, like you're just looking for the next bit that advances the plot, or like you're just looking for ways to pass the time. Arthur, the protagonist's "love interest" wasn't particularly well realized - I kind of defined him as "dickhead" in my mind and never look back - but Leo's little story, short as it was, was nice, and you really get a sense of Wilma's search for inspiration, and the pressure placed on her as a writer.
It really sells the tone, too, with its art style and its music, and even though you hardly get a glimpse or two of Vienna (you're in a cottage), you get a sense of the setting as well.
There's just not enough of it. I suppose I'm glad that this 'not enough' was condensed into such a short playtime instead of stretched out, but that still makes it feel insubstantial.

24656293.review:
Il gioco, presentatoci dall'etichetta indie Mipumi Games, non colpisce in quanto ad avventura grafica, negli anni sono state prodotte esperienze simili a questa, anche più durature (vedi "A Wolf Among Us" o la saga telltale di Game of Thrones), ma dalle sensazioni profonde che il gioco trasmette al primo impatto. Visivamente, il "negativo", adoperato nel prodotto, rende l'atmosfera malinconica e al tempo stesso sognante, in connessione tra le aspettative di Wilma, la protagonista, e noi stessi. Noi siamo lei e ci rispecchiamo nelle sue decisioni. 
"Perchè scrivi musica?". Questo semplice quesito è il perno su cui si fonda l'intero episodio. E' rivolta a noi, non come in un semplice GDR, dove impersonificare chiunque ti porta a vivere dove vuoi e comportarti senza dover rispondere delle tue azioni. Essere giovani, come la protagonista, ci fa osservare la realtà con gli occhi dell'adolescenza, da cui usciamo, di un ragazzo alle prime armi, che deve affrontare le avversità della vita e decidere se essere una persona normale, onesta e appagata da un'esistenza comune, o vivere i propri sogni ed affrontare quella "strada lunga e tortuosa" che spesso a metà percorso abbandoniamo, o per noia, o  per convenienza.
In ogni caso, le premesse ci sono, la storia, da quanto si intuisce, prenderà corpo molto velocemente (sono solo quattro episodi). Consiglio di non giocarlo per gli achievement (sono facilmente ottenibili interagendo con il mondo circostante). Spero in seguiti all'altezza.

24537970.review:
[h1]Niveauvoller musikalischer Wiener Schmäh um 1900[/h1]

[b]Einleitender Schmäh:[/b]
Das kleine Team von Mipumi Games hat uns da ein schönes kleines Indiespiel beschert, das sie in vier Episoden veröffentlichen werden. Die erste davon – [i]Silence[/i] – gibt es kostenlos als Appetizer; ein kluger Schachzug, der bei mir gezogen hat (Season-Pass: 9,99 €). Das Genre, das die Reihe bedient, wird von den Entwicklern [url=http://thelionssong.tumblr.com/]auf ihrem Blog[/url] (mit schönen Einblicken in den Entstehungsprozess) als [i]„Narrative Point and Click Adventure“ [/i] beschrieben (kurz gesagt ein Visual Novel mit einigen wenigen Interaktionen); es spielt in Wien um 1900 und dreht sich um vier künstlerisch begabte Menschen in dieser Zeit, ihre Erfahrungen und Ängste.

[b]Die G’schicht vo da Wilma (Geschichte und Personen):[/b]
Episode 1 handelt also von der 23-jährigen Wilma, aufstrebende Komponistin an der Wiener Kunstakademie, etwas unglücklich romantisch angezogen von ihrem Förderer und Lehrer, der von ihr als „seiner“ Entdeckung eine bahnbrechende neue Komposition erwartet. Um diese hohen Erwartungen zu erfüllen, zieht sich Wilma in eine Berghütte zurück, in der sie an ihrem Werk arbeiten will – jedoch durch Briefe, Telefonate, Alpträume, böhmische Knödel und die raue Umwelt abgehalten und doch entscheidend vorangebracht wird.
Die auftretenden Personen sind alle erfunden, jedoch tauchen immer wieder Berühmtheiten der Zeit in den Gesprächen auf: Freud, Mahler, Schönberg und Rilke’s Gedicht „Der Panther“. Bis auf Wilma, deren Charakter und Ängste sehr präzis widergegeben wird, und ihren Kontakt mit der Außenwelt namens Leo, bleiben die anderen Akteure blass (aber der Fokus liegt ja auch woanders).
Die Geschichte um Wilma ist in sich abgeschlossen, wird jedoch von einer kurz skizzierten, einleitenden Szene initiiert, deren Fortgang und Zusammenhang mit den anderen Episoden noch ungewiss ist; somit gibt es keinen Cliffhanger.

[b]Klassik(er) und Brauntöne – Sound und Graphik:[/b]
Das Geschehen spielt sich in wenigen Bildschirmhintergründen ab; dieser ist mit den Figuren und Objekten in einer m.E. sehr geeigneten, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=770353971]sechs Farben umfassenden Palette [/url]eingefärbt, die v.a. Brauntöne wiedergeben. Die Animationen sind begrenzt, hin und wieder gibt es auf das wichtigste reduzierte Animationseinspieler zu sehen.
Damit wird die Aufmerksamkeit auch auf das Wichtigste gelenkt – in diesem Fall die musikalische Untermalung und Soundkulisse. Erstere umfasst, wie soll es auch anders sein, klassische Musik der Zeit. Die Naturgeräusche jedoch werden clever in das Spielschema eingeflochten und auf den Text abgestimmt: Die ersehnte Komposition wird durch die Erlebnisse stimuliert, Emotionen und Geräusche erscheinen variabel je nach gewählter Aktion -> Sehr schön. Zudem gibt es keine Sprachausgabe, was den Effekt der Sounds noch verstärkt.

[b]Interaktivität um 1900 – Rätsel und co.:[/b]
Wie in der Einleitung bereits angedeutet, besteht das Spiel vornehmlich aus Visual Novel-Elementen, die per Text und Textgestaltung zu Entscheidungen des Spielers führen. Dass diese Einfluss auf das Episodenende haben, wird ziemlich bald deutlich (auch an den Achievements) – ob sie aber auch die gesamte Staffel betreffen, wie angekündigt, ist noch nicht abzusehen.
Aber es existieren auch Rätsel klassischer Point and Click-Adventures vor; etwas zu wenige und meist nur Umgebungsrätsel (suche das, verwende mit dem); etwas zu simplifiziert für meinen Geschmack.

[b]Sonstiges:[/b]
Einige kleine Dinge, die mir erwähnenswert scheinen: Im  Deutschen wird versucht, den Wiener Dialekt abzubilden, was zumeist gelingt und ab und zu ein Lächeln auf mein bayrisches Gesicht zauberte, teils aber auch etwas aufgesetzt wirkt und nicht komplett durchgehalten wird. Vereinzelt treten Schreib- und Kommafehler auf, die ja vielleicht noch ausgebessert werden.

Sehr erfreulich ist der unaufdringliche Humor, der immer wieder an die Oberfläche kommt und sich aus Knödel, Beschreibungen der Wiener Society und Freudschen Traumdeutungen speist. 

Die Achievements sind storygebunden und werden automatisch beim Durchspielen erlangt, je nach gewählten Entscheidungen eben; um 100% zu erlangen sind also sicher mehrere Durchläufe nötig – zudem scheint das Meisterkonzert-Achievement weiterhin zu Munkeleien und Gerüchten, Getuschel und verhinderten „Komplettionisten“ zu führen. 

[b]Sachertorte oder Schlagobers? – Abschließende Gedanken:[/b]
The Lion’s Song – Episode 1 hat mich für gut 50 Minuten in seinen Bann gezogen – ein Bann, der weniger auf spielerischer Aktivität beruhte, sondern auf einer glaubwürdigen Geschichte mit Emotionen, die man der Protagonistin mühelos abnahm; auf niveauvollem Humor und einem guten Konzept, das die Soundkulisse äußerst gut in den inneren Werdegang von Wilma integriert; auf einer Zeit, deren Zwänge und gesellschaftlichen Konventionen den heutigen zum Großteil nicht mehr ähneln, deren personelle Entwicklung aber jeden von uns früher oder später einholt. 
Empfehlenswert? Auf jeden Fall, wenn man eine Stunde zur Verfügung hat, um versinken zu wollen – denn zerstückelt gespielt verliert das Spiel an Charme.
Daher probiert es aus, das große Pro-Argument „kostenlos“ ist für mich am Ende ein kleines „passt eh“ geworden und ich freue mich auf die nächste Episode später dieses Jahr => [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=770353986]Sachertorte mit Schlagobers ist doch am besten[/url]!

24535583.review:
Forte de mon expérience avec Life Is Strange, les mélodies, les histoires prenantes et des choix nécessaires à faire, j'attendais beaucoup de ce jeu (du moins du premier épisode gratuit). Je savais que les graphismes n'allaient être que des pixels dans des tons ocrés/rougeâtres et ce n'est pas ce qui m'a déçue.
J'ai juste trouvé le gameplay ennuyeux. Je sais qu'il s'agit d'un Point & Click mais je voudrais tout de même avoir un peu plus de gameplay à faire que d'utiliser uniquement le click gauche de ma souris et d'entendre mon personnage parler...parler...
Après, il ne se passe pas vraiment grand chose. On incarne une jeune étudiante en musique qui doit composer une pièce pour un concert à Vienne et on la suit durant le processus d'écriture à trouver l'inspiration. Pour trouver l'inspiration nécessaire, il faut la faire "intéragir" avec les objets. J'utilise des guillemets vu qu'on ne la voit même pas réellement intéragir avec les objets. On clique sur un objet sur la table ou autour d'elle et elle le commentera.
L'épisode est réellement très court. Je l'ai fini en quelque chose comme 30 minutes et je n'ai pas sauté tous les dialogues.
Bref, ça peut être sûrement plaisant pour certains mais très certainement pas pour moi. Si je comprends bien, ce sera un lot de 4 épisodes donc je n'imagine pas un jeu avec une durée de vie de 2h avec un gameplay quasi-inexistant.

24435473.review:
[b]Top quality indie game. I'll try and go over the ups and downs of it thoroughly![/b]

This is the first review I've written, but it's the first game that I think deserves a review.

[h1]Story:[/h1]
The story centers around Wilma, a musician in late-victorian times. Electricity is rolling around, and telephones are just getting popular. The game seems to be focusing on building a background in this episode, as The story itself seems to have a beginning, middle and end within the episode. Let me say, this story writes in female characters better than any other game I've played, it's unconforming to stereotypes. You can see my Library to know that i've played with my share of female characters.

[h1]GamePlay:[/h1]
This is an indie game, so I never expected the play to be all that great. The controls themselves are about what you'd expect; clubby, choppy, glitchy point and click. However, the graphics and sound are superb. The game really shows itself in the story telling. Life is strange couldn't have done it better, this game tells stories better than all other games that I've played hands down!

[h1]Graphics:[/h1]
The graphics of this game help tell the story in a new way. I'll admit, at first, I disliked the graphics. 90% of this game is played in a cabin that only takes up half the screen. I found it annoying. While the art itself was [i]excellent[/i], the space usage was lacking. Then, you get a phone call. The layout then makes sense. You can see the person on the other line, in the other half of the window. When  the call ends, the room fades, and you are stuck once again in a room that only takes up half the screen. You then realize that You're feeling what the character is, and that the charachter only feels whole when they're on the phone with another person.

[h1]Music & sound[/h1]
The Music in this game, at first confusing, makes sense as you go on. The sound is superb, and I'm not normally a prissy user, but this game [i]Deserves[/i] headphones. Please use them if you play! The sounds are deep and rich.


Overall, I'd rate this game a perfect 5/5 indie game, and I'll be purchasing a season pass right after posting.
Thanks for the read, I hope you found it useful!

24430879.review:
There're only two words that could describe this game: utterly beautiful.
The music is magnificent, the pixel visuals are creative, and on top of that, this little point&click game combines real people (such as Freud) with excellently created fictional characters. Give this a try if you're a fan of story-telling, emotional games, and, definitely music. 

As Wilma, you're facing a burn-out and need to find your way back to creativity. You'll meet loneliness and fear, and --- the reward of solitude. In episode 2, you play as a painter who has lost his way, while chapter 3, focuses on a young mathematician. As a woman she is only laughed at when she attempts to solve the world's riddles. Episode 4 is currently still in development. All episodes are set in Austria and if you've never been there, you'll feel like you need to go now. The 3rd episode was definitely the most emotional episode for me, so grab your tissues and enjoy the journey. 

+ hard achievements (barely guides available for episode 1, be warned)
+ story rich
+ great soundtrack

~ some people may argue that the graphics of the game are too poor, but for me they were the most appealing aspect. I generally like pixel graphics but if you don't then don't buy the game.

fact:  this game is a true gem. and the first episode is free!

24424088.review:
The Lion’s Song es una aventura gráfica dividida en cuatro episodios enfocados en las mentes creativas de principios del siglo XX en Austria. Originalmente, el título fue creado en la Ludum Dare 30 y posteriormente pasó por Steam Greenlight donde consiguió la aprobación de la comunidad.

En el primer episodio de The Lion’s Song titulado “Silencio”, se nos presenta a Wilma, una joven compositora con un futuro prometedor. Su profesor, Arthur, ejerce tal presión sobre ella que la chica entra en un bloqueo mental con el que es incapaz de componer. Wilma, aconsejada por Arthur, se retira unos días a la cabaña de éste con el fin de recuperar su inspiración. Allí, alejada de la civilización, tendrá que enfrentarse a sus miedos, inseguridades y a la presión que recae sobre ella.

El primer episodio es totalmente gratis y, en unos 45 minutos, vais a disfrutar de una pequeña joya donde la música juega un papel vital, al igual que los sentimientos de frustración y superación de Wilma, que logran una profunda conexión con el jugador. Sin duda, The Lion’s Song ha sido una de las sorpresas del año.

[url=http://lafortalezadelechuck.com/analisis/analisis-the-lions-song/]ANÁLISIS COMPLETO EN LA FORTALEZA DE LECHUCK.COM [/url]

The Lion's Song to produkcja, która przypadła mi do gustu. Po zagraniu w pierwszy epizod już wiem, że chętnie sprawdzę kolejne. Dodam, że każdy odcinek skupia się innej osobie. Akcja gry osadzona jest w Austrii w latach 20. W pierwszym wcielamy się w Wilmę, młodą kompozytorkę cierpiącą na brak weny. Po spektakularnym sukcesie swojego pierwszego utworu, za namową swojego mentora, udaje się ona do położonej na odludziu chaty w Alpach. Tam dziewczyna próbuje znaleźć natchnienie. Wybory, jakie dokonamy podczas rozgrywki mają wpływ na zakończenie przygody.

The Lion's Song: Silence jest banalnie prosta. Żadna "zagadka" nie sprawi nikomu trudności. W grze głownie wysłuchujemy przemysleń protagonistki, oraz jej rozmow z telefonicznym przyjacielem. Nie pogniewałabym się, gdyby twórcy postanowili troszkę utrudnić kolejne epizody.

Świat gry przedstawiony jest w ciemnoburych barwach oraz rozpikselowanej grafice. Na pewno, nie każdemu spodoba się takie rozwiązanie, ale mnie nie przeszkadzało. Mankamentem jest liczba lokacji. Jest ich, bodajże, z 5.

Epizod 1 oceniam na 5.5/10

Very pleasant to play. The story, as I'm sure you're curious about, is just plain breathtaking. It doesn't have an overarching plot that could carry the story but what it possess is enough. For something that could be played under an hour, I greatly enjoyed this.

This story isn't a simple point and click story. At it's core it is still that yes but the game is more similar to Visual Novels more than anything. The story leads you to one ending but the journey there is something you create yourself. The choices themselves dictate how the story is gonna play out.

The art isn't much to write home about. It isn't anything special and yet, I felt that the designs are appropriate and fitting for the story. It was simple, not eye catching and not conspicuous. It was enough. It enhanced the story more than 'modern and pretty' art ever could.

The score is frankly great. Nice music.

Overall, I recommend you to play as 'yourself'.  See how your journey as Wilma takes you. This is the protagonist's story and at the same time, you.

[h1]Ci tengo a fare una piccola premessa, dicendo semplicemente che non sono un grande amante delle avventure grafiche, ed è uno dei generi che nell'ambito videoludico.[/h1]

Una volta ritrovatomi a vivere la storia, mi ha coinvolto fin dai primi minuti di gioco.
Ci ritroveremo nei panni di una ragazza che cercherà di realizzare i suoi sogni e desideri, nonostante le grandi difficoltà, insicurezze e ostacoli (che spesso sarà lai a mettersi davanti) che si ritroverà davanti.

24376144.review:
I highly recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of point & click games.  It's very simplistic and straightforward with some deeper themes that are weaved into the story.  Plus the "pixel graphic" style is very unique (sepia tones with hints of darker colors).

PROS
- Beautiful music and sound effects.  As a musician, I seriously wanted to cry at some parts for the beauty.
- Lovely artwork that sets the mood and setting for the game.  Reminds you of simpler times.
- Replayable, a good amount of achievements to keep you coming back and anticipating future releases.
- The main story, although simplistic, is somewhat relatable and still very beautiful.  All the items in which you use to complete your compisition tie in very well.  Interaction between characters, Arthur in particular, can get monotonous, since you only interract once, and he follows the same guidelines with some minor altercations depending on what you decide to say.  However, interactions between Leos are incredibly human and heartwarming.

CONS
- No save or dialogue skip buttons.

Although the game itself doesn't take long to complete (maybe 40 minutes if you wanna pace yourself), you really have to just sit down and complete it all, which can be a little challenging if you're short on attention like I am.  Also, although it is very replayable, I haven't found a way to skip through the beginning dialogue, which is quite lengthy and somewhat unnecessary after the first time you play the game.  Wish there was a way to speed through it or skip it entirely.

- There is one hidden achievement, A concert for the ages, that no one seems sure how to complete.  I'm not certain if it's bugged out or if it's just that hard to complete.  This is still a relatively new game anyways, so perhaps it is just a matter of more time is necessary to find the secret.

TL;DR  Highly recommend - Beautiful, retro graphics.  Inspiring music and sound effects.  Liked the story.  Could use some extra features to make gameplay more enjoyable.

[h1] The Lion's Song [/h1]

Viszont hátrányként azt tudom felmutatni,hogy rövid. Én 40 perc alatt kijátszottam,viszont bármikor újra lehet kezdeni más válaszlehetőségekkel.

24374371.review: Das Spiel dauert an für sich 1h, vielleicht auch 1,5h, wenn man sich Zeit lässt. Und beim ersten Durchgang wird man nur bedingt begeistert sein. 24374065.review:
Ich habe gerade die erste Episode gespielt .. und ich weiß nicht so recht. Ich mag Adventures, ich mag auch Spiele von Telltale (Walking Dead) oder Life is Strange, die sich mehr oder weniger von selbst ohne große Rätsel spielen. 

Bei Lions Song ist das ganze ein wenig anders. Man befindet sich nicht in einer lebenden Umgebung sondern in einer Abfolge von Zeichnungen mit einigen wenigen klickbaren Punkten. Und ich muss sagen, dass mich der Stil nicht so in den Bann gezogen hat. 

Spielzeit ist bei mir etws über drei Stunden. Liegt aber daran, dass ich gut 2,5 Stunden Mittagsschlaf gemacht habe, während das Spiel lief. Tatsächlich dürfte man ungefähr eine halbe bis dreiviertel Stunde für die Episode brauchen. 

Es gibt mehrere Gespräche mit verschiedenen Optionen. Einige der Optionen haben Einfluss auf den Fortgang der Episode und auf das finale Stück. Außerdem führen bestimmte Handlungen oder Nichthandlungen dazu, dass einem später Gesprächsoptionen neu oder nicht mehr zur Verfügung stehen. 

For Free kann man auf jeden Fall nichts falsch machen, das Spiel geht schnell und man kann probieren, ob einem der sehr eigenwillige Stil zusagt. Für Ep. 2 - 4 wird es auf den Preis ankommen, ob ich es kaufe oder nicht.

24355010.review:
The Lion's Song - Silence est un épisode très poétique, on ne peut pas le nier, avec de jolies musiques. J'ai longuement hésité avant de décider si je le recommandais ou pas, mais ses points forts sont contrebalancés par trop de points faibles. 
L'histoire est vraiment très très courte, nous n'avons pas tellement le temps de nous attacher à Wilma. C'est un Point&Clic plutot linéraire, même si l'on a le choix dans les dialogues, on ne voit pas tellement ce que ça change à l'histoire au final. Cela aura sûrement des repercussions dans les prochains épisodes, mais ce n'est pas très clair et pas vraiment exaltant. De plus, je trouve la scène finale plutôt décevante.

Il faut simplement cliquer sur les éléments du décor, rien de compliqué. mais là où, pour moi,  le bât blesse vraiment, c'est le parti-pris d'un style pixelisé couplé à une palette graphique des plus fades. Je peux accepter ce genre de graphismes d'un vieux jeu PC  remis sur Steam, mais pas d'un jeu de 2016. Même en restant poétique et particulier, il y avait moyen de faire mieux. Le sablier de "chargement" qui s'active régulièrement me ramène des années en arrière et ce n'était pas un bon souvenir ;). A reserver donc à ceux qui aiment le pixel-art.
EDIT : j'ai refait plusieurs fois l'épisode pour avoir les succès et la musique finale change selon les choix effectués, c'est intéressant.

Comme cet épisode est gratuit, je conseille d'y jouer pour vous faire votre propre avis, mais pour moi c'est clair, je n'achèterai pas la suite.

24352498.review:
I finished the first episode of 'The Lion's Song' in a little more than one hour. The play time is very short. But this is compensated by a strong emotional component. The game is very unique. Minimalistic graphics and colours in combination with an uncommon way of detecting musical inspiration within the protagonist by interacting with the environment, feels like something never done before. Episode 1 comes free of charge. The season pass for all episodes is only 10 Euros, a prize tag that suits the short, simple but very touching game.

Pros:
- emotional
- strong atmosphere
- mysterious
- unique
- new ideas

Cons:
- In order to collect all achievements you need to play the game more than once. Although this likely reveals more parts of the story because you make different decisions, it takes away the emotional magic of the first play though and somewhat reduces the game experience.

24341278.review:
Just going off of episode 1, this seems like a nice game. It revolves around looking for musical inspiration. 

You're in a cabin and interact with the items around you to find inspiration with which to build a musical piece. The majority of the game revolves around this, clicking items to get inspired, interspersed with insights into your life as a music student and conversations with others.

The graphics are drawn in a simple 8-bit painted style, and the story is told through subtitled text. The game uses lots of different effects to add empahsis on various types of speech, which is a ncie touch seeing as there isn't any accompanying voicing.

The game only took me about 45 minutes to complete, so its fairly short. And I don't really see this giving much replay value unless you really want to try all the different combinations of music.

A nice short game.
